intro: Damasonium dalechampii, commonly known as the water plantain, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Alismataceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often submerged or floating in aquatic environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Damasonium dalechampii typically grows in shallow, freshwater habitats such as ponds, ditches, and wet meadows. It plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
